byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE

abstract: Lebanese authorities arrest youngest son of late Libyan dictator Col Muammar el-Qaddafi, in connection with 1978 disappearance of Lebanese Shiite cleric in Libya; Hannibal Qaddafi, who was abducted by cleric's followers and delivered to Lebanese officials for questioning, was charged for withholding information about reopened case.
lead_paragraph: Hannibal Qaddafi was interrogated by a Lebanese judge, who issued a formal arrest warrant for him on charges of withholding information.

headline.main: Qaddafi Son Arrested by Lebanon in New Twist on Missing Imam Mystery
headline.print_headline: Qaddafi Son Arrested by Lebanon in New Twist on Missing Imam Mystery

snippet: Hannibal Qaddafi was interrogated by a Lebanese judge, who issued a formal arrest warrant for him on charges of withholding information.
